page.title: 12QUARNDON:LANDSCAPE,HOUSING
page.content: QUARNDON STANDS ON AN ELEVATED SITE AND OCCUPIES UNDULATING WOODED TERRAIN IT IS A MIXTURE OF RESIDENTIAL, FARMING, AND PARKLAND. THERE IS A VARIETY OF OLD AND MODERN HOUSING CHIEFLY BRICK BUILT. MOST ARE SPACIOUS WITH FOUR OR MORE BEDROOMS AND LARGE GARDENS. (SEE PHOTO C) NOTABLE LANDMARKS INCLUDE THE CHURCH SPIRE AND THE WATER TOWER IN NEARBY ALLESTREE PARK. ALLESTREE PARK LIES BETWEEN QUARNDON AND ALLESTREE. IT IS A LARGE MUNICIPAL PARK COVERING IN EXCESS OF 1 SQ KM. IT IS ON STEEP TERRAIN IN PART, AND INCLUDES AN EXCELLENT GOLF COURSE AND ORNAMENTAL PONDS (ARTIFICIAL) USED BY FISHERMEN AND LARGE FLOCKS OF WILD GEESE. THE PARK IS ALSO USED FOR OCCASIONAL ORIENTEERING AND CASUAL RECREATION.
